question: India’s first-ever driverless train operations has been inaugurated in which Metro rail service?
explanation:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has recently inaugurated India’s first-ever driverless train operations on Delhi Metro.
The Magenta Line (Janakpuri West – Botanical Garden) will have the first driverless operation. Fully operational National Common Mobility Card service was also launched on the Airport Express Line, under which anyone carrying a RuPay-Debit Card can travel on Airport Express Line using that card.
